LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-05T17:07:56Z Allan Gaw 2015-03-05T17:07:52+00:00 2015-03-05T17:07:52+00:00 Business of Discovery March 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;c5d6bcea.1503 Dear Colleagues<br><br>The five stages of grief when you hit the wrong key--'The Accidental Delete'<br><br>http://wp.me/p2v7Al-a9<br><br>Best wishes.<br><br>Allan<br><br>Allan Gaw MD, PhD, FRCPath, FFPM<br><br>www.allangaw.com<br>@ResearchET<br><br>------ACB discussion List Information--------<br>This is an open discussion list for the academic and clinical community working in clinical biochemistry.<br>Please note, archived messages are public and can be viewed via the internet. Views expressed are those of the individual and they are responsible for all message content.<br>ACB Web Site<br>http://www.acb.org.uk<br>Green Laboratories Work<br>http://www.laboratorymedicine.nhs.uk<br>List Archives<br>http://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/lists/ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN.html<br>List Instructions (How to leave etc.)<br>http://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/ Bradbury Wayne (RNL) North Cumbria University Hospitals 2015-03-05T16:08:50+00:00 2015-03-05T16:08:50+00:00 Re: Point of care Troponin T testing https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;ecdc383d.1503 It's entitled "NICE diagnostics guidance 15".<br><br>Wayne.<br><br>From: Paul Collinson [mailto:Paul.Collinson@stgeorges.nhs.uk]<br>Sent: 05 March 2015 15:43<br>To: Bradbury Wayne (RNL) North Cumbria University Hospitals; ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<mailto:ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK><br>Subject: RE: Point of care Troponin T testing<br><br>Its not NICE guidance it's a diagnostic advisory committee report and I applies to hs assays only Paul Collinson 2015-03-05T15:43:03+00:00 2015-03-05T15:43:03+00:00 Re: Point of care Troponin T testing https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;8c49f5dc.1503 Its not NICE guidance it's a diagnostic advisory committee report and I applies to hs assays only Myers Martin (LTHTR) 2015-03-05T11:32:56+00:00 2015-03-05T11:32:56+00:00 Re: Point of care Troponin T testing https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;c3066e9f.1503 Wayne,<br>The NICE guidance requires a high sensitive troponin. The Radiometer method is not a hsTnT assay and cannot be used for the zero and 3 hour NICE guidance.<br>martin<br><br>From: Clinical biochemistry discussion list [mailto:ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Bradbury Wayne (RNL) North Cumbria University Hospitals<br>Sent: 03 March 2015 13:30<br>To: ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Point of care Troponin T testing [...] Gina Sanki (Cwm Taf UHB - Biochemistry) 2015-03-04T12:12:28+00:00 2015-03-04T12:12:28+00:00 ACB FOCUS 2015 Registration https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;4254516b.1503 [cid:image001.jpg@01D05674.7BBF3CF0]<http://www.focus-acb.org.uk/><br><br>[cid:image002.jpg@01D05674.7BBF3CF0]<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>Just a reminder that the deadline for early bird registration is:<br>13th April 2015<br><br>For more details on registration please visit: http://www.focus-acb.org.uk/registration.asp<br><br>The programme is also now available on the website: http://www.focus-acb.org.uk/programme.asp<br><br>Kind regards,<br><br>Miss Gina Sanki<br><br>Senior Clinical Biochemist, Cwm Taf UHB<br><br>[cid:image005.jpg@01D05674.7BE08090]<br><br>---<br>Please consider the environment before printing this email<br><br>A wnewch chi ystyried yr amgylchedd cyn argraffu[cid:image001.jpg@01D05674.7BBF3CF0]<http://www.focus-acb.org.uk/><br><br>[cid:image002.jpg@01D05674.7BBF3CF0]<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>Just a reminder that the deadline for early bird registration is:<br>13th April 2015<br><br>For more details on registration please visit: http://www.focus-acb.org.uk/registration.asp<br><br>The programme is also now available on the website: http://www.focus-acb.org.uk/programme.asp<br><br>Kind regards,<br><br>Miss Gina Sanki<br><br>Senior Clinical Biochemist, Cwm Taf UHB<br><br>[cid:image005.jpg@01D05674.7BE08090]<br><br>---<br>Please consider the environment before printing this email<br><br>A wnewch chi ystyried yr amgylchedd cyn argraffu'r neges hon [...] Hall Elizabeth (EAST KENT HOSPITALS UNIVERSITY NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2015-03-04T12:03:48+00:00 2015-03-04T12:03:48+00:00 Mass spec tender https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;9293a4ab.1503 Dear All,<br><br>Does anyone have a recent tender specification for Mass Spec that they can share, please. I am particularly interested in how much detail you included about the instrumentation eg detector performance. If the tender includes specific clinical assays is it sufficient to say the mass spec must be capable of doing x, y and z? [...] Rob Lord 2015-03-04T11:26:58+00:00 2015-03-04T11:26:58+00:00 Elevated Serum Lipase - but no sign of pancreatitis at PM https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;9d620c46.1503 Hello<br><br>I would be grateful for your advice regarding the following -<br><br>29 year old bodybuilder (user of anabolic steroids) admitted with abdo<br>pain. Serum lipase on admission = 295 U/L (ref 12-53). Treated as<br>acute pancreatitis.<br><br>However, at post mortem no sign of acute pancreatits (although the<br>pancreas was large).<br><br>Histopathologist asking for advice. Only pathological finding is a<br>degree of myocardial damage. [...] Craig McKibbin 2015-03-03T17:45:26+00:00 2015-03-03T17:45:26+00:00 NOx https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;363093d1.1503 Hi Mailbase<br><br>Are any labs out there able to quantitate urinary nitrate and serum nitrate and nitrite?<br><br>We've been approached by a research team at our Trust to help them with a study on dietary nitrate supplementation.<br><br>The one entry in AssayFinder appears to be a dead link.<br><br>100+ subjects on offer...<br><br>Thanks<br>Craig<br><br>Royal Surrey County Hospital<br>Guildford<br>GU2 7XX [...] Bradbury Wayne (RNL) North Cumbria University Hospitals 2015-03-03T13:29:53+00:00 2015-03-03T13:29:53+00:00 Point of care Troponin T testing https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;ad031d27.1503 One of our A/E Consultants is keen to investigate using his blood gas analyser (Radiometer AQT90) for the early rule out of MI in the A/E dept.<br><br>Radiometer have a Troponin T assay for this analyser but it is not a high sensitivity assay (lowest value with 10% CV is about 30 ng/L). [...] Metz, Michael (Health) 2015-03-03T15:56:36+10:30 2015-03-03T15:56:36+10:30 glycosylated ferritin https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;1f8e71dd.1503 Hello all,<br>Does anyone in Australasia measure glycosylated ferritin for identification of Adult Still's Disease?<br>Cheers,<br>Michael<br><br>Michael P Metz<br>BS, MD, DABP, FAAP, MAACB, FRCPA<br>Consultant Chemical Pathologist<br>SAPath at The Women's & Children's Hospital<br>72 King William Road,<br>North Adelaide, South Australia 5006<br>Australia<br>telephone 08 8161 7483<br>mobile 0421 098 430<br>e-mail michael.metz@health.sa.gov.au<br>------ACB discussion List Information--------<br>This is an open discussion list for the academic and clinical community working in clinical biochemistry.<br>Please note, archived messages are public and can be viewed via the internet. Views expressed are those of the individual and they are responsible [...] Dan Turnock 2015-03-02T10:58:38+00:00 2015-03-02T10:58:38+00:00 Principal Clinical Scientist post https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;3666f29e.1503 Please see link below for further details of our replacement Band 8A Clinical Scientist post in Biochemistry based at York Hospital.<br><br>Job reference on NHS Jobs = 419-0161-D15K<br>https://www.jobs.nhs.uk/xi/vacancy/ffc2685d1195c3ea05c1551cd5127b80/?vac_ref=913682630<br><br>This job is a substantive full time post and is a direct replacement. Applications will close on 15th March, please note that interviews will be held on the 27th March at York Hospital. For further details of the post or to arrange a visit to the lab then please contact either Dan Turnock (daniel.turnock@york.nhs.uk, 01904 72 1847) or Alison Jones (alison.jones@york.nhs.uk, 01904 72 5786). [...] David Halsall 2015-02-28T07:05:30+00:00 2015-02-28T07:05:30+00:00 Fwd: Principal Clinical Scientist position https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;9906aa36.1502 We have a principal job out to advert in our Biochemical Genetics Unit.<br>It is on both NHS Jobs (Job Reference: 180-PP-CUH-1536) and HealthJobsUK<br>(Job ref: HJUK/180-PP-CUH-1536) websites.<br><br>Applications from enthusiastic and experienced Clinical Scientists are<br>invited for the post of Principal Clinical Scientist in the Biochemical<br>Genetics Unit. The Unit provides Newborn Blood Spot Screening for East<br>Anglia, together with metabolic investigations for hospitals within this<br>area and further afield. You will be expected to participate in all<br>aspects of the metabolic and screening service, including clinical<br>liaison, teaching and training, as well as deputising for the director<br>in [...] Graham Jones 2015-02-28T00:23:20+00:00 2015-02-28T00:23:20+00:00 Re: Synovial CRP https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;867dabae.1502 Angela,<br><br>I would be very cautious about measurement of anything in synovial fluid. The ones I have seen are often very viscous and I would be concerned about accurate sample aspiration in addition to any other possible effects of the matrix on the measurement. A validation of any method is necessary to ensure that it works in these samples. [...] Houston Charles (NHS Greater Glasgow & Clyde) 2015-02-27T22:35:22+00:00 2015-02-27T22:35:22+00:00 Re: Synovial CRP https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;3526b3e9.1502 Hi Angela,<br>Doubt very much doubt if any CRP methods were approved use with synovial fluid i.e. CE marked or manufacturer's data approved for measuring CRP in synovial fluid - completely different matrix to serum.<br><br>Would disagree with conclusion - it might be inferred maybe ??<br><br>paper concludes - In conclusion, as CRP assays are standard tests in medical laboratories, the measurement of synovial CRP may be easily transferred into clinical practice, expanding the diagnostic battery for chronic periprosthetic hip infections. [...] Kremmyda Angela (SHREWSBURY AND TELFORD HOSPITAL NHS TRUST) 2015-02-27T16:21:01+00:00 2015-02-27T16:21:01+00:00 Synovial CRP https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;dfe1771c.1502 Dear mailbase,<br><br>We've had a request from one of our orthopaedic surgeons to measure CRP in synovial fluid - apparently it is a better marker for periprosthetic infection than serum CRP. Is there anyone out there that has validated the method for synovial fluid/ offering the service? (nothing on assay finder)<br>Any drops of wisdom will be gratefully received.<br>Thanks, [...] Gabriella Sciarrone 2015-02-27T15:20:29+00:00 2015-02-27T15:20:29+00:00 LAST CHANCE TO ENTER THE IYOL COMPETITION! https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;3cd001e7.1502 Dear All,<br><br>Each month Taylor & Francis are running a competition alongside their International Year of Light collection.<br><br>Enter now for a chance to win a $100 Amazon voucher and a copy of Nonlinear Optics: Principles and Applications! Hurry- the competition closes on the 28th February!<br><br>Find out more and enter: http://svy.mk/1vGASBC<br><br>------ACB discussion List Information--------<br>This is an open discussion list for the academic and clinical community working in clinical biochemistry.<br>Please note, archived messages are public and can be viewed via the internet. Views expressed are those of the individual and they are responsible for all message content.<br> [...] Mosaheb Sabrina (HAMPSHIRE HOSPITALS NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2015-02-25T13:57:53+00:00 2015-02-25T13:57:53+00:00 Band 8D Consultant Clinical Biochemist Post at Hampshire Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;3e0327a6.1502 Dear All,<br><br>Please can I draw your attention to the post above that is now live on NHS jobs. The job reference number is 251-V874. The closing date is 17th of March 2015. The successful applicant will work across both the Basingstoke and Winchester hospital sites.<br><br>Please see the link below for details: [...] Elizabeth MacNamara, Dr. 2015-02-25T12:33:14+00:00 2015-02-25T12:33:14+00:00 Re: High vitamin B levels https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;62cf25ce.1502 I would do nothing. A better example is looking for cancer in unprovoked DVT. Apart from a few simple tests no decrease in mortality or morbidity is found in doing extensive workup and the amount of harm in even doing tumour markets is greater than the benefit. Of course I would take a good history and physical and probably do a FIT. Everything else would be depending on symptoms. [...] Jordaan Marieke 2015-02-25T11:00:32+00:00 2015-02-25T11:00:32+00:00 High vitamin B levels https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;6df4d261.1502 Dear all<br><br>In the paper titled "The pathophysiology of elevated vitamin B12 in clinical practice" published in Q J Med 2013; 106:505-515 various investigations are suggested if an unexplained high vitamin B12 level is found.<br><br>Beyond advising FBC, LFT and CRP how far would colleagues go to exclude a possible underlying malignant or non-malignant condition? [...] Myers Martin (LTHTR) 2015-02-24T13:33:30+00:00 2015-02-24T13:33:30+00:00 Traceability of calibrants for urine catecholamine https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;3ca93515.1502 All,<br><br>The documentation provided from the supplier of our urine catecholamine assay does not demonstrate traceability of calibrants for catecholamines, which is required for UKAS accreditation.<br><br>Does anyone know of any possible alternative suppliers that supply traceable calibrants?<br><br>Thanks<br><br>Martin<br><br>This message and any files transmitted with it are confidential and intended solely for the individual(s) addressed. If you have received this e-mail in error then please note that disclosing, copying, distributing or retaining this message or any part of it is strictly prohibited. Please notify the sender immediately and delete it from your system. Any views or opinions presented [...] Ruth Ayling 2015-02-24T13:22:56+00:00 2015-02-24T13:22:56+00:00 Re: Vitamin D2 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;3db5cfb4.1502 Dear Nick<br>What exactly is she eating as the many Quorn products are not suitable for<br>vegans?<br>bw<br>Ruth<br><br>On 24 February 2015 at 10:34, Nick Miller <nickmiller46@gmail.com> wrote:<br><br>> Dear All,<br>> A vegan patient has come up with a high-ish serum vitamin D2 with very low<br>> D3 (in spite of taking D3). Could Quorn, which is a microfungus, be a<br>> source of vitamin D2? McCance and Widdowson doesn't seem to know anything<br>> about this and my other searches have drawn a blank. Presumably her low<br>> serum D3 reflects fat malabsorption (not taking her D3 [...] Myers Martin (LTHTR) 2015-02-24T11:31:16+00:00 2015-02-24T11:31:16+00:00 Re: Vitamin D2 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;e19bda9c.1502 Nick,<br><br>I do not know the answer to your question, but I would appreciate any feedback from users on the merits of separate D2 and D3 reporting. There are several equimolar immunoassays on the market that measure total 25OH-D (D2 and D3). Why do we need to report D2 in addition to D3? [...] Nick Miller 2015-02-24T10:34:52+00:00 2015-02-24T10:34:52+00:00 Vitamin D2 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;a11e29ce.1502 Dear All,<br>A vegan patient has come up with a high-ish serum vitamin D2 with very low<br>D3 (in spite of taking D3). Could Quorn, which is a microfungus, be a<br>source of vitamin D2? McCance and Widdowson doesn't seem to know anything<br>about this and my other searches have drawn a blank. Presumably her low<br>serum D3 reflects fat malabsorption (not taking her D3 with fatty food, to<br>which she is averse). We almost never see significant serum D2 levels, so<br>any comments would be most welcome. [...] JONES Stuart (Pathology) (RF4) BHR Hospitals 2015-02-23T14:17:35+00:00 2015-02-23T14:17:35+00:00 Re: Patients and direct access to lab test results https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;b6f23c14.1502 See also: Patient commentary: Direct access would beat receiving test results with the receptionist's interpretation http://www.bmj.com/content/350/bmj.h797?etoc=<br>Stuart<br><br>From: Clinical biochemistry discussion list [mailto:ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Freedman Danielle (RC9) Luton & Dunstable Hospital TR<br>Sent: 23 February 2015 09:06<br>To: ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Patients and direct access to lab test results<br><br>Dear all<br>Please find article that appears in this weeks hard copy of BMJ that you might find of interest<br>Kind Regards<br>Danielle<br>Dr Danielle B Freedman<br>Chair , Board Lab Tests Online UK [...] Mohmed Ashmaig 2015-02-23T04:56:02-05:00 2015-02-23T04:56:02-05:00 Thyroid function https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;410ae3d9.1502 Dear all,<br>Just checking what everyone do to test for markers for thyroid function. Specifically about conversion of T4 to T3,<br>Best regards!<br>Mohmed<br><br>Mohmed Ashmaig PhD<br>Senior Scientist<br>Research and Development<br><br>------ACB discussion List Information--------<br>This is an open discussion list for the academic and clinical community working in clinical biochemistry.<br>Please note, archived messages are public and can be viewed via the internet. BMJ]<http://bmj.com/> Jonathan Middle 2015-02-21T09:30:24+00:00 2015-02-21T09:30:24+00:00 AQMLM Audit Workshop https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;1d74f016.1502 For all interested in Audit!<br><br>We are holding a Workshop on Tuesday 10th March on the "Theory & Practice<br>of Audit" at the Research Park, Birmingham B15 2SQ.<br><br>Full details of the programme are here<br><http://www.aqmlm.org.uk/?q=forthcoming>. The meeting is approved for 5<br>credits CPD by the RCPath and IBMS (ref: MD060N15).<br><br>Non-members are welcome to attend; there are plenty of places available. [...] Ann Bowron 2015-02-19T16:22:19+00:00 2015-02-19T16:22:19+00:00 South West Metabolic Study Day https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;a651bb03.1502 The fourth South West Metabolic Study Day will take place on Thursday 21st May 2015 at the Holiday Inn, Taunton.<br><br>Topics will include: An approach to Neurometabolic disorders, Emerging treatments for Lysosomal Storage Disorders, Niemann-Pick Disease, Expanded Newborn Screening and Ketogenic Dietary Management. There will be interactive workshops during the day. [...] Pullan Nicola (ROYAL UNITED HOSPITAL BATH NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2015-02-19T15:19:40+00:00 2015-02-19T15:19:40+00:00 Significance of a slightly elevated calcitonin??? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;8484abfd.1502 Dear Mailbase,<br><br>Can anyone help with this?<br><br>One of our endocrinologists is trying to determine the cause of a slightly elevated calcitonin in a 66 yo male. This was first measured as part of a research study/trial (!) (I'm not sure of the details of this study) and has been repeated several times, with all results being between 14-20 ng/L (normal limit <11.8). The patient is clinically well and has no family history of MTC. [...] SALLY HANTON 2015-02-19T12:41:53+00:00 2015-02-19T12:41:53+00:00 Anti-laminin antibodies https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;be268d5c.1502 Dear all,<br><br>We have received a request for anti-laminin antibodies on a patient with "blistering rashes" - can anyone advise where we could send the sample for analysis and whether the test would be appropriate to those clinical details?<br><br>Many thanks,<br><br>Sally<br><br>Dr Sally Hanton<br>Senior Clinical Biochemist<br>Aintree University Hospitals NHS Trust<br>Longmoor Lane<br>Liverpool<br>L9 7AL<br><br>Tel: 0151 529 3990<br>Fax: 0151 529 3310 [...] OConnor John (ROYAL DEVON AND EXETER NHS FOUNDATION TRUST) 2015-02-19T10:44:09+00:00 2015-02-19T10:44:09+00:00 Measurement of Uncertainty https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;49da3098.1502 Dear Collective<br>Old chestnut, but I am aware that some trusts are having issues of interpretation of how they are deriving their MoU's<br><br>I have found the official UKAS paper on this (attached)<br>http://www.ukas.com/library/Technical-Information/Pubs-Technical-Articles/Pubs-List/LAB12.PDF<br>if your trust blocks attachments<br>In that document there is a completely unambiguous statement about the standard uncertainty unit<br>STANDARD UNCERTAINTY<br>7.2.1<br>The standard uncertainty is defined as one standard deviation. The potential<br>for mistakes at a later stage of the evaluation may be minimised by<br>expressing all uncertainty components as one standard deviation. This may<br>require adjustment of some uncertainty values, such as those obtained [...] Robert Cramb 2015-02-19T10:25:31+00:00 2015-02-19T10:25:31+00:00 Theranos https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACB-CLIN-CHEM-GEN;c6568bbe.1502 Followers of the lists will recall the exchanges about "Theranos".
